intro: Stigmaphyllon mucronatum var. nicaraguense, commonly known as the Nicaraguan stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
